Você invoca suas aparições através do poder do canto e da dança, conectando o espiritual ao físico. Essas performances podem ser de sua própria criação ou seguir os ritos específicos da sua religião.

Canção de Invocação (1º): Você pode cantar para os espíritos para que eles girem e dancem ao seu redor. Você ganha o talento @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.M8jbV0il124Ve5oV]{Círculo de Espíritos}.

Invocação Dançante (9º): O movimento do seu corpo concede poder à sua magia. Quando você @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Saltar}, Dar um Passo ou @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]{Rolar Através}, você também Sustenta uma magia de aparição ou magia de receptáculo.

Invocação de Louvor (17º): Suas liturgias chamam os espíritos mesmo no calor da batalha. Quando você rola iniciativa, você pode usar Círculo de Espíritos como uma ação livre. Se sua primeira ação em seu primeiro turno for lançar um truque de aparição concedido por sua aparição primária, você reduz o número de ações que leva para lançá-lo em 1 (mínimo 1 ação).

Lore.name: Conhecimento
Lore.description:
Conhecimento e informação vêm livremente para você. Você pode usar esse conhecimento para ganhar poder ou talvez para entender os mistérios divinos do multiverso. Você pode ter um conduíte para o lendário Registro Akáshico, manter uma conexão telepática sutil com o subconsciente coletivo de todas as criaturas vivas ou seguir os passos de divindades como Abadar, Irori, Nethys, o sobrinho estudioso de Irori, Gruhastha, a deusa feérica tríplice do destino Magdh, ou a figura de deus aeon conhecida como a Mônada.

Magias Concedidas truque: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OhD2Z6rIGGD5ocZA]{Ler Aura}; 1º: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.D442XMADp01qJ7Cs]{Elo Mental}; 3º: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ZYoC630tNGutgbE0]{Hipercognição}; 6º: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5BbU1V6wGSGbrmRD]{Deixa pra Lá}

Magias de Revelação inicial: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.k2QrUk7jWMAWozMh]{Drenagem Cerebral}; avançada: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.LbPLNWlLCxKCo5gF]{Acessar Conhecimento}; maior: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XULNb8ItUsfupxqH]{Segredo Terrível}

Domínios Relacionados conhecimento, magia, segredo, verdade

Perícia de Mistério Ocultismo e uma perícia de Conhecimento de sua escolha

Talento de Oráculo @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.55WR55op9BIdgF1B]{Sussurros de Fraqueza}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.XQjR07LkDedC7tkc]{Maldição do Conhecimento Torrencial}

Lurker in Devouring Dark.name: Ser que Espreita na Treva Devoradora
Lurker in Devouring Dark.description:
Os seres que espreitam na treva devoradora são mais frequentemente encontrados perto de antigos naufrágios, icebergs mortais e outros lugares onde gelo e águas profundas são mais prevalentes. Em lugares onde a Tapeçaria Sombria se intromete no mundo, podem ser encontrados variantes dos seres que espreitam na treva devoradora que oferecem Conhecimento da Tapeçaria Sombria no lugar de Conhecimento de Navegação e cujas magias de água e gelo causam dano de vazio.

Perícias de Aparição Conhecimento do Oceano, Conhecimento de Navegação

Magias de Aparição Truque @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.thAHF1zxNplLCJPO]{Rajada Cáustica}; 1º @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.k34hDOfIIMAxNL4a]{Gavinhas Macabras}; 2º @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9h9YCncqah6VNsKf]{Agarrão Ácido}; 3º @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.oUDNCArkQTdhllxD]{Orbe Aquoso}; 4º @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rwWtpZpkNYvypknx]{Punho das Profundezas}; 5º @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.R5FHRv7VqyRnxg2t]{Muralha de Gelo}; 6º @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.R5r4vtmlvOA8hDiF]{Pilar de Gelo}; 7º @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0EzLXIpPPH0LOKqt]{Profundezas Famintas}; 8º @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.C2GYCH3TtUFqPfdX]{Fenda Ártica}; 9º @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4WS7HrFjwNvTn8T2]{Implosão}

Magia de Embarcação @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wTldMJx0vyBAehrI]{Forma da Treva Devoradora}

Avatar Tentáculos da Escuridão Velocidade 70 feet, nadar Velocidade 70 feet

Corpo a Corpo 1 tentáculos agarradores (alcance 30 feet), Dano @Damage[(6d10+6)[concussão]] mais Agarrar

Maestro.name: Maestro
Maestro.description:
Sua musa o inspira constantemente a alcançar patamares mais elevados de proeza artística. Para muitos bardos, um professor ou rival desempenha esse papel, embora alguns mirem mais alto e tentem superar grandes compositores do passado ou abrir um caminho totalmente novo. Se sua musa for uma criatura sobrenatural, pode ser alguém que adora se apresentar, como um anjo coral ou um azata liraquiano; se for uma divindade, pode ser Shelyn. A arte inspirada por uma musa maestro é precisa e inventiva, uma conquista formalista.

Como um bardo com uma musa maestro, você é uma inspiração para seus aliados e confiante em suas habilidades musicais e oratórias.

Talento de Musa @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.sVjATEo8eqkAosNp]{Composição Persistente}

Magia de Musa @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.szIyEsvihc5e1w8n]{Acalmar}

Magical Fortitude.name: Fortitude Mágica
Magical Fortitude.description:
Oráculo, Feiticeiro, Mago O poder mágico melhorou a resiliência do seu corpo. Seu nível de proficiência em testes de Fortitude aumenta para especialista.

Bruxa O poder do seu patrono aumenta sua resiliência física. Seu nível de proficiência em testes de Fortitude aumenta para especialista.

Magnum Opus.name: Obra-Prima
Magnum Opus.description: Você ajustou seu lançamento de magias para o mais alto calibre. Adicione duas magias ocultas comuns de 10º nível ao seu repertório. Você ganha um único espaço de magia de 10º nível que pode usar para lançar essas magias usando lançamento de magias de bardo. Ao contrário de outros espaços de magia, você não pode usar espaços de 10º nível com habilidades que lhe dão mais espaços de magia ou que permitem lançar magias sem gastar espaços de magia. Você não ganha mais magias de 10º nível conforme sobe de nível, mas pode pegar o talento Bis Perfeito para ganhar um segundo espaço.

Majestic Will.name: Vontade Majestosa
Majestic Will.description: Sua mente e vontade são temperadas por seu domínio das forças mágicas. Seu nível de proficiência em testes de Vontade aumenta para mestre. Quando você rolar um sucesso em um teste de Vontade, você obtém um sucesso crítico em vez disso.

Major Creed.name: Credo Maior
Major Creed.description: Você ganha proficiência mestre com a arma favorecida da sua divindade. Seu nível de proficiência para testes de Fortitude aumenta para mestre. Quando você rolar um sucesso em um teste de Fortitude, você obtém um sucesso crítico em vez disso.

Major Curse.name: Maldição Maior
Major Curse.description: Você aprendeu a tolerar melhor os poderes conflitantes que causam estragos em seu corpo. O valor máximo de @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zXZjC8HLaRoLR17U]{Amaldiçoado} que você pode ter aumenta de amaldiçoado 2 para amaldiçoado 3.

Manifold Alloy.name: Liga Múltipla
Manifold Alloy.description: Você criou várias ligas que contêm propriedades úteis de vários metais e substitui várias partes de sua arma ou munição por peças dessas ligas. Sua inovação de arma é ferro frio e prata. Isso significa que você causa mais dano a uma variedade de criaturas sobrenaturais, como demônios, diabos e fadas.

Martial Weapon Mastery.name: Maestria em Arma Marcial
Martial Weapon Mastery.description: Você compreende totalmente suas armas. Seus níveis de proficiência para armas simples, armas marciais e ataques desarmados aumentam para mestre.

Master Detective.name: Mestre Detetive
Master Detective.description:
Como um mestre detetive, você pode solucionar qualquer caso e encontrar todas as pistas disponíveis. Sua reputação o precede e até os criminosos e enganadores mais habilidosos o temem. Seu nível de proficiência para o DC de classe do investigador aumenta para mestre.

Além disso, se você entrar em um novo local que inclua outra pista para responder à pergunta no centro de uma de suas investigações ativas, o Mestre informa a você sobre a existência da pista e seu tipo: um objeto, pessoa, efeito de magia ou algo semelhante. Quando você encontrar a pista, o Mestre o informará que você a encontrou.

Se houver mais de uma pista no local, o Mestre escolhe uma para informá-lo. Quando você encontrar qualquer uma das pistas naquele local, o Mestre o informará que você a encontrou, mesmo que não seja a pista que ele escolheu ou que haja outras pistas que você não encontrou.

Master Overdrive.name: Superpropulsão Mestre
Master Overdrive.description: Seu domínio da invenção e do artesanato aprimora ainda mais sua Superpropulsão. Você se torna um mestre em Artesanato e, em uma Superpropulsão bem-sucedida, aumenta o dano adicional em um total de 2, substituindo o aumento da Superpropulsão especialista.

Master Spellcaster.name: Mestre Conjurador
Master Spellcaster.description:
Animista Sua afinidade com as aparições às quais você se liga aumentou ainda mais a potência de sua magia. Seus níveis de proficiência para modificador de ataque de magia e DC de magia aumentam para mestre.

Bardo Você dedilha os fios da magia como as cordas de uma harpa. Seus níveis de proficiência para modificadores de ataque de magia e DCs de magia aumentam para mestre.

Druida A magia primal responde ao seu comando. Seus níveis de proficiência para modificador de ataque de magia e DC de magia aumentam para mestre.

Magus Você fortifica suas magias com proeza magistral. Seus níveis de proficiência para jogadas de ataque de magia arcana e DCs de magia aumentam para mestre.

Oráculo Você realmente entende o poder divino profundo e complexo dentro do seu mistério. Seus níveis de proficiência para jogadas de ataque de magia divina e DCs de magia aumentam para mestre.

Psíquico Você ganhou acesso aos cantos mais profundos de sua própria mente. Seus níveis de proficiência para jogadas de ataque de magia oculta e DCs de magia aumentam para mestre.

Feiticeiro Você alcançou maestria sobre a magia em seu sangue. Seus níveis de proficiência para modificador de ataque de magia e DC de magia para magias da tradição de sua linhagem aumentam para mestre.

Convocador Sua conexão com seu eidolon é forte o suficiente para lhe conceder maestria sobre as magias associadas. Seus níveis de proficiência para modificador de ataque de magia e DC de magia para magias da tradição do seu eidolon aumentam para mestre.

Bruxa Você alcançou maestria sobre a magia do seu patrono. Seus níveis de proficiência para modificador de ataque de magia e DC de magia aumentam para mestre.

Mago Você comanda uma habilidade de conjuração de magias superlativa. Seus níveis de proficiência para modificador de ataque de magia e DC de magia aumentam para mestre.

Master Strike.name: Golpe Mestre
Master Strike.description: Você pode incapacitar um inimigo desavisado com um único golpe. Seu nível de proficiência para o DC de classe do ladino aumenta para mestre. Você ganha a ação livre @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Rlp7ND33yYfxiEWi]{Golpe Mestre}.

Master Strikes.name: Golpes de Mestre
Master Strikes.description: Você aprimorou seu corpo em uma arma ainda mais mortal. Seus níveis de proficiência para ataques desarmados e armas simples aumentam para mestre.

Master Tricks.name: Truques de Mestre
Master Tricks.description: Você dominou os movimentos de luta de um ladino. Seus níveis de proficiência aumentam para mestre para todas as armas simples, armas marciais e ataques desarmados.

Master of Mind and Spirit.name: Mestre da Mente e do Espírito
Master of Mind and Spirit.description: Suas aparições protegem sua mente contra intrusões hostis e o protegem dos efeitos de entidades que procuram controlar sua mente. Seu nível de proficiência em testes de Vontade aumenta para mestre. Quando você rolar um sucesso em um teste de Vontade, você obtém um sucesso crítico em vez disso.

Masterful Hunter.name: Caçador Magistral
Masterful Hunter.description:
Você aprimorou suas habilidades como caçador a níveis incríveis. Seu nível de proficiência para o DC de classe do patrulheiro aumenta para mestre. Se você tem magias de guardião, seu nível de proficiência para ataques de magia e DCs de magia aumenta para mestre. Ao usar uma arma de ataque à distância na qual você tem proficiência mestre, você pode ignorar a penalidade se atacar sua presa caçada dentro do segundo e terceiro incrementos de alcance da arma.

Se você tem proficiência mestre em Percepção, você ganha um bônus de circunstância +4 em testes de Percepção quando você @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Procura} sua presa, e se você tem proficiência mestre em Sobrevivência, você ganha um bônus de circunstância +4 em testes de Sobrevivência quando você @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Rastrear} sua presa. Você também ganha um benefício adicional dependendo da sua vantagem de caçador.

Rajada: Você pode combinar sua maestria em armas com mira habilidosa para fazer uma série de ataques precisos. Se você tem proficiência mestre com sua arma, sua penalidade de ataque múltiplo para ataques contra sua presa caçada é -2 (-1 com uma arma ágil) em seu segundo ataque do turno e -4 (-2 com uma arma ágil) em seu terceiro ataque e ataques subsequentes do turno.

Astúcia: Sua maestria em perícias permite que você domine sua presa. Se você tem proficiência mestre em Enganação, Intimidação, Furtividade ou na perícia que você usa para Lembrar de Conhecimento sobre sua presa, aumente o bônus de circunstância contra a presa com essa perícia de +2 para +4. Se você tem proficiência mestre com sua armadura, aumente o bônus de circunstância para CA contra a presa de +1 para +2.

Precisão: Sua maestria em armas permite que você atinja as áreas vitais de sua presa várias vezes. Na segunda vez em um round que você atingir sua presa caçada, você também causa 1d8 de dano de precisão. No 19º nível, seu segundo acerto em um round contra sua presa caçada causa 2d8 de dano de precisão e seu terceiro acerto em um round contra sua presa caçada causa 1d8 de dano de precisão.

0.label: Para Rastrear a presa caçada (Caçador Magistral)

1.label: Para Procurar a presa caçada (Caçador Magistral)

Masterful Hunter (Flurry).name: Caçador Magistral (Rajada)
Masterful Hunter (Flurry).description:
Aprimoramento de Caçador MagistralNível 17

Você pode combinar sua maestria em armas com mira habilidosa para fazer uma série de ataques precisos.

Se você tem proficiência mestre com sua arma, sua penalidade de ataque múltiplo para ataques contra sua presa caçada é -2 (-1 com uma arma ágil) em seu segundo ataque do turno e -4 (-2 com uma arma ágil) em seu terceiro ataque e ataques subsequentes do turno.

Masterful Hunter (Outwit).name: Caçador Magistral (Astúcia)
Masterful Hunter (Outwit).description:
Aprimoramento de Caçador MagistralNível 17

Sua maestria em perícias permite que você domine sua presa. Se você tem proficiência mestre em Enganação, Intimidação, Furtividade ou na perícia que você usa para Lembrar de Conhecimento sobre sua presa, aumente o bônus de circunstância contra a presa com essa perícia de +2 para +4.

Se você tem proficiência mestre com sua armadura, aumente o bônus de circunstância para CA contra a presa de +1 para +2.

Notas de Automação: O bônus para lembrar de conhecimento foi configurado apenas para arcana, artesanato, natureza, ocultismo, religião e sociedade. O bônus para CA é baseado em sua proficiência desarmada e não na proficiência da armadura que você está vestindo.

0.label: Contra ataques da presa caçada (Caçador Magistral)

4.label: Lembrar de Conhecimento sobre a presa caçada (Caçador Magistral)

5.label: Lembrar de Conhecimento sobre a presa caçada (Caçador Magistral)

6.label: Lembrar de Conhecimento sobre a presa caçada (Caçador Magistral)

7.label: Lembrar de Conhecimento sobre a presa caçada (Caçador Magistral)

8.label: Lembrar de Conhecimento sobre a presa caçada (Caçador Magistral)

9.label: Lembrar de Conhecimento sobre a presa caçada (Caçador Magistral)

Masterful Hunter (Precision).name: Caçador Magistral (Precisão)
Masterful Hunter (Precision).description:
Aprimoramento de Caçador MagistralNível 17

Sua maestria em armas permite que você atinja as áreas vitais de sua presa várias vezes.

Na segunda vez em um round que você atingir sua presa caçada, você também causa 1d8 de dano de precisão.

No 19º nível, seu segundo acerto em um round contra sua presa caçada causa 2d8 de dano de precisão e seu terceiro acerto em um round contra sua presa caçada causa 1d8 de dano de precisão.

0.label: Segundo ataque na presa caçada neste round

2.label: Terceiro ataque na presa caçada neste round

Mastermind.name: Mente Brilhante
Mastermind.description:
Você confia em seu intelecto para elaborar esquemas intrincados, planejando 10 etapas à frente, onde outros podem planejar três. Você pode ser um detetive motivado, um mestre espião a serviço de uma casa poderosa ou um aspirante a senhor do crime ou corretor de informações.

Se você identificar uma criatura com sucesso usando @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Lembrar de Conhecimento}, essa criatura fica @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenida} contra seus ataques até o início do seu próximo turno; se você obtiver um sucesso crítico, ela fica desprevenida contra seus ataques por 1 minuto.

Você é treinado em Sociedade e em uma das seguintes perícias à sua escolha: Arcana, Natureza, Ocultismo ou Religião. Você pode escolher Inteligência como seu atributo chave.

Medium.name: Médium
Medium.description:
Você é particularmente bom em agir como um condutor para energia espiritual e tende a se associar mais livremente com uma ampla gama de aparições, embora tenda a não formar o laço profundo com uma única aparição que outros animistas costumam desenvolver.

Invocação da Unidade (1º): As linhas entre seu corpo e sua aparição são borradas. Você ganha o talento @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.Gw8tjM91F6i3fOnR]{Abdicar do Controle}.

Invocação Dupla (9º): Você pode construir laços poderosos com várias aparições. Você pode selecionar duas de suas aparições sintonizadas para serem suas aparições primárias. Se você tiver o recurso de classe @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.1MHXjNczVZfVvDP6]{Encarnação Suprema}, você escolhe qual forma de avatar da aparição você manifesta cada vez que conjura a magia @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ckUOoqOM7Kg7VqxB]{Avatar}. O número de Pontos de Foco em seu conjunto de foco é igual ao número de magias de foco que você tem ou ao número de aparições primárias às quais você está sintonizado, o que for maior (máximo 3).

Invocação da Sincronização (17º): A linha entre suas intenções e as da aparição que o possui se confunde, permitindo que vocês se apoiem melhor no calor do combate. Enquanto você tiver Abdicado do Controle para uma aparição, você ganha os seguintes benefícios adicionais:

  • Uma vez por round, você pode tentar um teste de Lembrar de Conhecimento como uma ação livre.
  • Todos os Golpes que você fizer com uma arma ou ataque desarmado causam 2 pontos de dano espiritual adicional.
  • Você ganha resistência igual à metade do seu nível contra todos os danos físicos, mas tem fraqueza igual ao seu nível para dano espiritual.

Medium Armor Expertise.name: Especialização em Armadura Média
Medium Armor Expertise.description: Você aprendeu a se defender melhor contra ataques. Seus níveis de proficiência para armadura leve, armadura média e defesa desarmada aumentam para especialista.

Medium Armor Expertise (Inventor).name: Especialização em Armadura Média (Inventor)
Medium Armor Expertise (Inventor).description:
Você aprendeu a se defender melhor contra ataques. Seus níveis de proficiência para armadura leve, armadura média e defesa desarmada aumentam para especialista.

Se você tem uma inovação de armadura média ou pesada, você ganha acesso ao efeito de especialização crítico com sua inovação de armadura.

Medium Armor Mastery.name: Maestria em Armadura Média
Medium Armor Mastery.description: Sua habilidade com armadura leve e média melhora, aumentando sua capacidade de evitar golpes. Seus níveis de proficiência para armadura leve e média, bem como para defesa desarmada, aumentam para mestre.

Metal Gate.name: Portão de Metal
Metal Gate.description:
Junção de Portão de Metal
Explosão Crítica O alvo sofre 1d6 de dano de sangramento persistente; se a criatura tiver o traço metal ou for feita de metal, em vez disso, sofre 1d6 de dano persistente sem tipo de ferrugem. Você ganha um bônus de item a este dano persistente igual ao seu bônus de item em jogadas de ataque de impulso, como de um atenuador de portão.
Resistência Elemental eletricidade, metal
Junção de Impulso Escolha ácido, eletricidade ou perfuração. Até o início do seu próximo turno, cada vez que uma criatura tocar em você ou causar dano a você com um ataque corpo a corpo desarmado ou arma corpo a corpo sem alcance, ela sofre dano do tipo escolhido igual à metade do seu nível (mínimo 1 de dano).
Junção de Aura Seus inimigos na aura sofrem uma penalidade de status -1 em ataques com objetos de metal e sofrem uma penalidade de status -1 em CA se estiverem vestindo armadura de metal, tiverem o traço metal ou forem feitos de metal.
Junção de Perícia Artesanato, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.ASy9AKEIRxPYUi5o]{Reparo Rápido}

Metal Strikes.name: Golpes Metálicos
Metal Strikes.description: Você pode ajustar seu corpo para fazer ataques desarmados imbuídos da energia mística de metais raros. Seus ataques desarmados são tratados como ferro frio e prata. Isso permite que você cause mais dano a uma variedade de criaturas sobrenaturais, como demônios, diabos e fadas.

Metallic Reactance.name: Reatância Metálica
Metallic Reactance.description: Os metais em sua armadura são cuidadosamente ligados para aterrar eletricidade e proteger de reações químicas ácidas. Você ganha resistência igual a 3 + metade do seu nível a dano de ácido e eletricidade. Quando sob os efeitos de Superpropulsão, a resistência aumenta em 2.

Methodology.name: Metodologia
Methodology.description:
Seus estudos o tornaram experiente em muitas áreas, mas uma em particular atraiu seu intenso interesse. Escolha uma metodologia. As metodologias são as seguintes:

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.ln2Y1a4SxlU9sizX]{Metodologia de Ciências Alquímicas}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.g3mNzNphtVxyR9Xr]{Metodologia de Empirismo}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.O3IX7rTxXWWvDVM3]{Metodologia de Medicina Forense}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.UIHUNNYZyQ3p4Vmo]{Metodologia de Interrogatório}

Mighty Rage.name: Fúria Poderosa
Mighty Rage.description: Sua fúria se intensifica e permite que você acerte mais forte no início de uma luta. Seu nível de proficiência para o DC de classe do bárbaro aumenta para especialista. Além disso, quando você usa Temperamento Explosivo, o primeiro Golpe que você fizer durante seu primeiro turno causa dano adicional igual ao seu dano de @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Ah5g9pDwWF9b9VW9]{Fúria}.

Miraculous Spell.name: Magia Milagrosa
Miraculous Spell.description: Você é exaltado por sua divindade e ganha magias verdadeiramente incríveis. Você ganha um único espaço de magia de 10º nível e pode preparar uma magia nesse espaço usando conjuração de clérigo. Ao contrário de outros espaços de magia, você não pode usar espaços de 10º nível com habilidades que lhe dão mais espaços de magia ou que permitem lançar magias sem gastar espaços de magia. Você não ganha mais magias de 10º nível conforme sobe de nível, mas pode pegar o talento @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.QDjpZKOrWIV1G8XJ]{Criador de Milagres} para ganhar um segundo espaço.

Mirror.name: Espelho
Mirror.description:
Os implementos de espelho representam desorientação, ilusão e prestidigitação, curvando e mudando uma perspectiva e a maneira como você olha as coisas. Enquanto espelhos maiores possuem as mesmas conotações místicas, os taumaturgos sempre escolhem espelhos pequenos, portáteis e de mão como implementos para que possam usá-los facilmente durante as aventuras. Os implementos de espelho são associados ao naipe de chaves do baralho da sorte e aos signos astrológicos do estranho e da andorinha.

Benefício de Iniciado

Você aprende como usar seu espelho para projetar outra versão de si mesmo cuja realidade é uma questão de perspectiva. Você ganha a ação @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Mh4Vdg6gu8g8RAjh]{Reflexo do Espelho}.

Benefício de Adepto

Seu eu espelhado se estilhaça em fragmentos punitivos quando danificado. Enquanto Reflexo do Espelho estiver em vigor, quando um inimigo adjacente a um de seus espaços causar dano a você, essa versão sua explode em fragmentos de espelho. Isso encerra Reflexo do Espelho (estabelecendo a versão restante de você como a real) e causa dano cortante a todas as criaturas em uma @Template[emanation|distance:5] ao redor de onde seu eu espelhado estava. O dano é igual a 2 + metade do seu nível ou o dano do ataque que o acionou, o que for menor. Você é imune a este dano.

Intensificar Vulnerabilidade

Reforçar seu espelho permite que ele pregue peças nos sentidos do seu inimigo enquanto curva a luz para um lado ou para o outro. Você se torna @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Oculto} para o alvo da sua Explorar Vulnerabilidade conforme seu espelho distorce suas percepções. Como normal para ocultação onde sua localização geral ainda é óbvia, você não pode usar essa ocultação para @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Esconder} ou @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Mover-se Furtivamente}.

Benefício de Paragon

Você se tornou tão habilidoso em refletir a si mesmo que pode combinar a criação de um reflexo com seus outros movimentos para agir imediatamente. Quando você usa Reflexo do Espelho, você pode fazer com que um de seus eus imediatamente @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interaja}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Procure} ou @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Golpeie}.

Mirrored Aegis.name: Mirrored Aegis
Mirrored Aegis.description:
Usage any shield

This shield is polished so brightly it can reflect even spiritual and ethereal attacks.

Immanence (aura) The mirrored aegis emits an aura in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15] that protects you and all allies in the aura from harm, granting a +1 status bonus to AC. If the mirrored aegis houses your divine spark for 10 uninterrupted minutes, it is restored to full Hit Points.

Transcendence—@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.IBEbFlMmDbGsrN4G]{Raise the Walls} 1 (force, transcendence)

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.IBEbFlMmDbGsrN4G inline]

Moderate Creed.name: Moderate Creed
Moderate Creed.description: You gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.NMWXHGWUcZGoLDKb]{Reactive Strike} as a cleric feat.

Modular Head.name: Modular Head
Modular Head.description: You've constructed a multi-purpose, adjustable striking surface for your weapon, or you've made special ammunition you can swiftly alter. Your innovation gains the modular trait for bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing. When you Interact to use the modular trait, you can also choose to give the weapon the nonlethal trait if it doesn't currently have it, or to remove that trait if it's currently nonlethal.

Momentum Retainer.name: Momentum Retainer
Momentum Retainer.description:
Melee only

A special weighted device lets your weapon retain more of its momentum when you attack. Your innovation gains the forceful and versatile B traits.

Monarch of the Fey Courts.name: Monarch of the Fey Courts
Monarch of the Fey Courts.description:
Monarchs of the fey courts make their homes near places with strong ties to the First World, or in places where nymphs once held sway. They are drawn to animists who blend an appreciation for art and nature's beauty with a ruler's ambition. Monarchs of fey courts are vain, capricious, and do not easily forgive slights or poor manners.

Apparition Skills Art Lore, Fey Lore

Apparition Spells Cantrip @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uZK2BYzPnxUBnDjr]{Tangle Vine}; 1st @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm}; 2nd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Mt6ZzkVX8Q4xigFq]{Create Food}; 3rd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IihxWhRfpsBgQ5jS]{Enthrall}; 4th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion}; 5th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.U58aQWJ47VrI36yP]{Hallucination}; 6th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate}; 7th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.O6VQC1Bs4aSYDa6R]{Mask of Terror}; 8th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Jvyy6oVIQsD34MHB]{Uncontrollable Dance}; 9th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.FmNDwqMEjeTEGPrY]{Unfathomable Song}

Vessel Spell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SAmyaiVKTDrUNjot]{Nymph's Grace}

Avatar Queen of the Winter Court Speed 50 feet, fly Speed 50 feet, swim Speed 50 feet

Melee 1 queen's caress (reach 15 feet, agile), Damage @Damage[(6d10+6)[mental]]

Ranged 1 monarch's spite (mental, range 120 feet, versatile cold), Damage @Damage[(6d6+6)[mental]]

Monk Expertise.name: Monk Expertise
Monk Expertise.description: Your proficiency rank for your monk class DC increases to expert. If you have qi spells, your proficiency rank for spell attacks and spell DCs increases to expert.

Mortal Harvest.name: Mortal Harvest
Mortal Harvest.description:
Usage a sickle or any weapon from the axe, flail, or polearm group

This weapon, once used for felling trees or crops, now harvests lives instead.

Immanence The mortal harvest deals 1 persistent spirit damage per weapon damage die to creatures it Strikes.

Transcendence—@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.24k7qCV8S95yYK3y]{Reap the Field} 1 (transcendence)

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.24k7qCV8S95yYK3y inline]

Mortality Reforged.name: Mortality Reforged
Mortality Reforged.description: Inner fire has burned away the frailty of a mortal body. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save, you get a critical success instead.

Mosquito Witch.name: Mosquito Witch
Mosquito Witch.description:
Your patron is a mysterious being known as the Mosquito Witch. You do not know why you were chosen, and in many cases, you wish that you hadn't been. She may have made herself known to you through terrifying prophetic visions and nightmares, or you might have instead received her patronage in the form of swarming insects, their buzzing opening your ears to magic and their bites filling your body with power. Frightening events plague your wake: strange accidents, dead animals, and glowing red eyes in the darkness. Whether or not you're aware of the Mosquito Witch's influence, you have an affinity with insects, and typically draw their attention wherever you go.

Spell List primal

Patron Skill Nature

Lesson of the Unbridled Hive The Mosquito Witch grants you control over insects. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.BItahht2hEHvR9Bt]{Buzzing Bites} hex cantrip and your familiar learns @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gfPjmG6Fe6D3MFjl]{Pest Form}.

Familiar of Swarm's Heart Your familiar is surrounded by a cloud of harmless insects. When you Cast or Sustain a hex, the insects swarm to protect you and your allies. Until the start of your next turn, your familiar grants concealment to you or any ally while sharing the same space..

Multisensory Mask.name: Multisensory Mask
Multisensory Mask.description:
Subterfuge Suit only

You've built a multisensory mask over your armor that protects you by distorting your figure from all senses, leaving behind only a hazy image, muffled sounds, and so forth. While wearing the armor, you gain concealment against all creatures, even if they are using a nonvisual precise sense, such as a bat's echolocation. As normal for effects that leave your location obvious, you can't use this concealment to Hide or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}. If you use a hostile action, the concealment ends until you restore the mask as a single action, which has the manipulate trait.

Muscular Exoskeleton.name: Muscular Exoskeleton
Muscular Exoskeleton.description: Your armor supports your muscles with a carefully crafted exoskeleton. When you send your armor into overdrive, the exoskeleton supplements your feats of athletics as well. When under the effects of Overdrive, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks; if you're a master in Crafting, this increases to a +2 circumstance bonus.

Muses.name: Muses
Muses.description:
As a bard, you select one muse at 1st level. This muse leads you to great things and might be someone you know, a supernatural creature, location, deity, philosophy, or captivating mystery. Depending on the type of inspiration you receive, your 1st-level muse grants you a specific 1st-level bard feat and adds a spell to your repertoire.

In addition to this, each muse opens the door to many later bard feats. If one type of inspiration is not enough to represent your muse, consider the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.a898miJnjgD93ZsX]{Multifarious Muse} feat.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.4ripp6EfdVpS0d60]{Enigma}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.YMBsi4bndRAk5CX4]{Maestro}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.y0jGimYdMGDJWrEq]{Polymath}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.N03BtRvjX9TeHRa4]{Warrior}

Mutagenist.name: Mutagenist
Mutagenist.description:
You focus on bizarre mutagenic transformations that sacrifice one aspect of a creature's physical or psychological being in order to strengthen another.

Formulas Two common 1st-level alchemical mutagens.

Field Benefit When you use a mutagen, you gain a number of temporary Hit Points equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 0) plus half your level. These temporary Hit Points last for 1 minute or until the mutagen's duration expires, whichever comes first. You can't gain temporary HP from drinking a mutagen again for 1 minute.

Field Vials You can drink the contents of one your versatile vials to suppress the drawback you take from one mutagen currently affecting you until the beginning of your next turn. A vial used this way loses the acid, bomb, and splash traits and gains the elixir trait. If you have more than one drawback due to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jSkJIWPfSZZzvYzq]{Combine Elixirs} or a similar ability, drinking the vial suppresses one drawback of your choice.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.V4Jt7eDnJBLv5bDj]{Field Discovery} (5th) The mutagens flowing through your blood have altered your body chemistry. When you roll a Fortitude save while affected by a mutagen and dislike the result, you can end the effect of the mutagen to reroll the save. This is a fortune effect.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.wYOdTCWQQ6ec8I6b]{Advanced Vials} (11th) When you drink one of your field vials, you also gain resistance to physical damage for the same duration. The resistance is equal to half your level.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.1BKdOJ0HNL6Eg3xw]{Greater Field Discovery} (13th) If you imbibe another mutagen while you are under the effects of a mutagen, you can gain the benefits and the drawbacks of both mutagens at once, despite the fact that they both have the polymorph trait and would not normally function together. If you come under the effects of any further mutagens while benefiting from two mutagens, you lose the benefit of one of the former mutagens of your choice, while retaining the drawbacks of all the mutagens. If you are under the effects of two mutagens and you come under the effect of a non-mutagen polymorph effect, you lose the benefits of the mutagens while retaining the drawbacks of both. Your field vial benefit applies to one mutagen of your choice.

Mysterious Resolve.name: Mysterious Resolve
Mysterious Resolve.description: The power of your mystery blazing in your soul makes it harder for other powers to grip your mind. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Will save, you get a critical success instead.

Mystery.name: Mystery
Mystery.description:
An oracle wields divine power, but not from a single divine being. This power could come from a potent concept or ideal, the attention of multiple divine entities whose areas of concern all touch on that subject, or a direct and dangerous conduit to raw divine power. This is the oracle's mystery, a source of divine magic not beholden to any deity.

Choose the mystery that empowers your magic. Your mystery grants you additional spells, and special focus spells called revelation spells. Your mystery also gives you a unique cursebound ability that lets you draw upon the divine, as well as dictating the effects of the oracular curse that falls upon you when you touch too much of this power.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.qvRlih3u7vK3FYUR]{Ancestors} Voices of past generations teach and haunt you.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.g3HTg0z3doXZZzAV]{Ashes} You see all things in the world as fleeting and temporary, waiting to be purified into their base essence: the ash left behind after a burning fire.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.gjOGOR30Czpnx3tM]{Battle} You embody the virtues upheld by heroes of legend.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.1PHDn7WJFtR3NgTr]{Blight} A spring bud will wither, a mighty oak will crash to the forest floor, and a callow youth will grow into maturity, then decline into old age.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.IaxmCkdsPlA52spu]{Bones} Death always seems near, and the dead speak to you.
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.RI2EMRBBPNSoTJXu]{Cosmos} You draw power from the stars and the spaces between.
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.GTSvbFb36InvuH0w]{Flames} You dance with fire and do your best to remain unscorched by it.
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.o1gGG36wpn9mxeop]{Life} The teeming energies of life flow through you out into the world.
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.tZBb3Kh4nJcNoUFI]{Lore} You gain access to unparalleled, overwhelming knowledge.
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.W9cF7wZztLDb1WGY]{Tempest} Wind, waves, and storms rage at your beck and call.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.EslxR2sbDK9XJaAl]{Time} Whether by accident, fate, or purposeful meddling, you exist slightly outside of time.

Reading a Mystery Entry

A mystery entry contains the following information, followed by a description of that mystery's curse.

Granted Spells You automatically add the spells listed here to your spell repertoire, as described in Spell Repertoire on page 130. At 1st level, you gain a cantrip and a 1st-rank spell. You learn the other spells on the list as soon as you gain the ability to cast oracle spells of that rank.

Revelation Spells You automatically gain your mystery's initial revelation spell at 1st level and can gain more by selecting the Advanced Revelation, Greater Revelation, and Diverse Mystery oracle feats. These spells start on page 259.

Related Domains These are the cleric domains associated with your mystery. You gain domain spells, which you can cast as revelation spells, by taking the Domain Acumen and Domain Fluency feats. At 11th level, the divine access class feature also gives you additional slotted spells based on your domains. The domains and their domain spells appear on page 372 of Player Core. Domains marked with an asterisk (*) are found in Pathfinder Lost Omens Divine Mysteries.

Mystery Skill You become trained in the listed skill. A few mysteries make you trained in more than one skill.

Oracle Feat You gain this 1st-level oracle feat. This is a cursebound feat, so using it aggravates your oracular curse.

Mystic Strikes.name: Mystic Strikes
Mystic Strikes.description: Focusing your will into your physical attacks imbues them with mystical energy. Your unarmed attacks become magical, allowing them to get past resistances to non-magical attacks. However, you still need an item such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.FNDq4NFSN0g2HKWO]{Handwraps of Mighty Blows (+1)} to gain an item bonus to attack rolls or increase your attacks' weapon damage dice.

Natural Reflexes.name: Natural Reflexes
Natural Reflexes.description: You've honed your reflexes dodging falling trees and pounding hail. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Reflex save, you get a critical success instead.

Nature's Edge.name: Nature's Edge
Nature's Edge.description: You always find the weak points in your foes' defenses when they're on unfavorable terrain. Enemies are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to you if they're in difficult terrain.

Noble Branch.name: Noble Branch
Noble Branch.description:
Usage a staff, bo staff, fighting stick, khakkara, or any weapon in the spear or polearm weapon group

This humble stick-like weapon has an elegant simplicity to it, affording you reliable strikes over flashy maneuvers.

Immanence The noble branch deals 2 additional spirit damage per weapon damage die to creatures it Strikes.

Transcendence—@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.oaJeGdGPmHiNT5mP]{Strike, Breathe, Rend} 1 (spirit, transcendence)

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.oaJeGdGPmHiNT5mP inline]

Obedience.name: Obedience
Obedience.description:
Society is ordered with good reason, and people should conduct themselves as appropriate for their proper place.

Edicts enforce proper hierarchies, topple illegitimate hierarchies, lead when you're the most suited to the task

Anathema let one who is lesser than you wield power over you or lead you

Champion's Reaction @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.M8RCbthRhB4bxO9t]{Iron Command}

Relentless Reaction (9th Level) If the enemy refuses, it takes persistent spirit damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

Exalted Reaction (11th Level) Each enemy in your champion's aura other than the triggering creature must also either drop @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} or take mental damage (each enemy chooses). These creatures take only minimum damage (typically 3 damage at 11th level, 4 at 12th, 5 at 16th, and 6 at 19th), and the effects they take can't be adjusted by anything that changes your Iron Command. For instance, the Iron Repercussions feat couldn't turn the damage into persistent mental damage for creatures other than the triggering creature

Occult Spellcasting.name: Occult Spellcasting
Occult Spellcasting.description:
You draw upon magic from esoteric knowledge. You are a spellcaster and can cast spells of the occult tradition using the Cast a Spell activity.

As a bard, when you cast spells, your incantations might be musical riffs or clever limericks, your gestures might incorporate dance and dramatic pantomiming, and you might accompany your spellcasting by playing a musical instrument.

Each day, you can cast up to two 1st-rank spells. You must know spells to cast them, and you learn them via the spell repertoire class feature. The number of spells you can cast each day is called your spell slots.

As you increase in level as a bard, your number of spells per day increases, as does the highest rank of spells you can cast.

Some of your spells require you to attempt a spell attack roll to see how effective they are, or have your enemies roll against your spell DC (typically by attempting a saving throw). Since your key ability is Charisma, your spell attack rolls and spell DCs use your Charisma modifier.

Of Verse Unbroken.name: Of Verse Unbroken
Of Verse Unbroken.description:
Though you are a warrior, you respect the power of song, oratory, and other arts, knowing it is these forces that make fights worth fighting. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.9rHQn9Hn8JhY2e4V]{Energized Spark} feat for your choice of sonic or vitality. When you critically succeed on a Strike, haunting melodies play around the target, making them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} unless they succeed on a @Check[will|against:exemplar] save against your class DC.

When you Spark Transcendence, your divine spark releases a sublime song that harmonizes with your allies. Until the start of your next turn, any of your allies that starts their turn within 30 feet of you can hum to Sustain one of their effects that can be sustained. This is a free action triggered by the ally's turn beginning. Your song then ends, and that ally can't benefit from this ability again for 10 minutes. This is an auditory and mental effect.

Offensive Boost.name: Offensive Boost
Offensive Boost.description:
You've made additions to your innovation to upgrade your offensive capabilities. Your improvements make any Strikes that rely on your innovation deal an additional 1d6 damage, with a type determined by the boost you choose. If your innovation is armor, the boost applies to your melee unarmed Strikes and to your melee Strikes with one weapon you choose during daily preparations; if your innovation is a construct, the boost applies to your construct companion's Strikes; and if your innovation is a weapon, the boost applies to your Strikes with your innovation. You can spend downtime to switch to a different boost in the same way as switching your modification. Choose one of the following boosts, with the damage type in parentheses.

  • Chill (Cold) Your innovation rapidly absorbs heat, creating an intense chill.
  • Ignition (Fire) Your innovation shoots out jets of searing flame.
  • Jolt (Electricity) Your innovation jolts foes with charges of electricity.
  • Momentum (Bludgeoning) Your innovation slams into foes with added momentum.
  • Saws (Slashing) Your innovation reveals spinning sawblades during your attacks.
  • Spike (Piercing) Your innovation reveals wicked spikes during your attacks.
  • Vitriol (Acid) Your innovation releases spurts of caustic acid.

Note: The included effect is only needed for construct innovations and armor innovations for selecting their daily preparation weapon.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.ut5SVyCSXel69nnd]{Effect: Offensive Boost}

Omnirange Stabilizers.name: Omnirange Stabilizers
Omnirange Stabilizers.description:
Ranged only

You've modified your innovation to be dangerous and effective at any range. If your innovation had the volley trait, remove the volley trait. Otherwise, increase your innovation's range increment by 50 feet or an amount equal to the weapon's base range increment, whichever is more

On the Case.name: On the Case
On the Case.description: As an investigator, you think of your adventures as cases waiting to be solved. You gain one activity and one reaction you can use to investigate cases: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.xTK2zsWFyxSJvYbX]{Pursue a Lead} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.25WDi1cVUrW92sUj]{Clue In}.

Opportune Riposte.name: Opportune Riposte
Opportune Riposte.description: You turn the tables on foes who fumble, capitalizing immediately on their mistake. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EfjoIuDmtUn4yiow]{Opportune Riposte} reaction.

Oracle Spellcasting.name: Oracle Spellcasting
Oracle Spellcasting.description:
You have an unfiltered connection to the great powers of the universe and the planes beyond, and you can let this power spill forth in the form of divine magic. You are a spellcaster, and you can cast spells of the divine tradition using the Cast a Spell activity. As an oracle, when you cast spells, your incantations may spill from your lips rapidly as you speak in tongues or intone in a voice not quite your own, and your gestures might be wild and unrestrained as religious ecstasy briefly touches your mind.

Each day, you can cast up to three 1st-rank spells. You must know spells to cast them, and you learn them via the spell repertoire class feature. The number of spells you can cast each day is called your spell slots.

As you increase in level as an oracle, your number of spells per day increases, as does the highest rank of spells you can cast, as shown on the Oracle Spells per Day table (shown below).

Some of your spells require you to attempt a spell attack to see how effective they are, or have your enemies roll against your spell DC (typically by attempting a saving throw). Since your key attribute is Charisma, your spell attack modifiers and spell DCs use your Charisma modifier.

Heightening Spells

When you get spell slots of 2nd rank and higher, you can fill those slots with stronger versions of lower-rank spells. This increases the spell's rank, heightening it to match the spell slot. You must have a spell in your spell repertoire at the rank you want to cast in order to heighten it to that rank. Many spells have specific improvements when they are heightened to certain ranks. The signature spells class feature lets you heighten certain spells freely.

Cantrips

Some of your spells are cantrips. A cantrip is a special type of spell that doesn't use spell slots. You can cast a cantrip at will, any number of times per day. A cantrip is automatically heightened to half your level rounded up—this is usually equal to the highest rank of oracle spell slot you have. For example, as a 1st-level oracle, your cantrips are 1st-rank spells, and as a 5th-level oracle, your cantrips are 3rd-rank spells.

Oracular Clarity.name: Oracular Clarity
Oracular Clarity.description:
You now fully grasp the nature of the divine power behind your mystery, allowing you to work magic akin to miracles. Add two common 10th-rank divine spells to your repertoire. You gain a single 10th-rank spell slot you can use to cast one of those two spells using oracle spellcasting.

You don't gain more 10th-rank spells as you level up, unlike other spell slots, and you can't use 10th-rank slots with abilities that give you more spell slots or that let you cast spells without expending spell slots. You can take the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.PExiZZTSP4p7TZaW]{Oracular Providence} feat to gain a second slot.

Oracular Curse.name: Oracular Curse
Oracular Curse.description:
As an oracle, you can tap into the pure and unmitigated divine power of creation to supplement your spellcasting via cursebound abilities. These abilities grant you special benefits, but the backlash of letting this power into your mortal body manifests as an oracular curse. The more cursebound abilities you use, the more your curse worsens, but you might gain divine benefits even as it tightens its grip on your soul.

Your oracular curse is expressed using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zXZjC8HLaRoLR17U]{Cursebound} condition, a unique condition that affects only oracles. Immediately after the first time you use a cursebound ability, you become cursebound 1, and if you use a cursebound ability while you are already cursebound, you increase the value of your cursebound condition by 1 after the ability resolves. At lower levels, you can tolerate only a modest amount of divine power, and your cursebound condition can't increase beyond cursebound 2; as you grow in levels, you can open yourself to even more power and your cursebound condition can progress to 3 and finally 4. Once saturated in divine power, your soul can't absorb any more, and so you can't use a cursebound ability if you are already at your maximum cursebound condition.

Your oracular curse lists the specific effects of being cursebound, which are cumulative as your curse progresses. You remain cursebound until you Refocus, which reduces your cursebound condition by 1 in addition to restoring a Focus Point. As your curse is a direct result of divine power, you cannot mitigate, reduce, or remove the effects of your curse or any ability with the cursebound trait by any means other than Refocusing. For example, if a cursebound effect makes creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from you, you can't negate that concealed condition through a magic item or spell, such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Gb7SeieEvd0pL2Eh]{Sure Strike} (though you would still benefit from the other effects of that item or spell). Likewise, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Cleanse Affliction} and similar abilities don't affect your curse at all.

At 1st level, you gain a cursebound oracle feat determined by your @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.PRJYLksQEwT39bTl]{Mystery}, and you can learn additional cursebound abilities through oracle feats.

The Cursebound Condition

Your oracular curse is constricting around you as you receive divine punishment after drawing too deeply on your mystery's powers. Cursebound is a condition that affects only creatures with an oracular curse, and cursebound always includes a value. Your specific oracular curse imposes unique negative effects depending on your cursebound value. You can remove the cursebound condition only by Refocusing.

Oracular Senses.name: Oracular Senses
Oracular Senses.description: You have always been able to sense a bit more than others. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to expert.

Order of the Chain.name: Order of the Chain
Order of the Chain.description:
Members of the Order of the Chain are skilled at hunting down and capturing criminals, especially those who dare flee from justice.

Lesser Benefit @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.AGiIjgLOFuahmwiT]{Shackles of Law}

Greater Benefit @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.XOAtP64xiSRIofsY]{Sturdy Bindings}

Order of the Gate.name: Order of the Gate
Order of the Gate.description:
Favored Weapon @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.rQWaJhI5Bko5x14Z]{Dagger}

The Hellknight signifers of the Order of the Gate seek to prevent lawlessness of all types through the use of their considerable spellcasting prowess and command of fiendish outsiders.

Lesser Benefit @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jrDCPvkruz8y740Z]{Locate Lawbreakers}

Greater Benefit @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.w7dOgJvqAqyqSeSQ]{Devil Allies}

Order of the Godclaw.name: Order of the Godclaw
Order of the Godclaw.description:
Favored Weapon @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.5fu6dCtqhdBnHNqh]{Morningstar}

The Order of the Godclaw's Hellknights see their cause as a holy mandate from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.JndhOIHnQoMwnsw3]{The Godclaw}. They seek to punish criminals with a zeal rarely matched by others who enforce the law.

Lesser Benefit @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.UHejQS4uCNGRI45t]{Dedication to the Five}

Greater Benefit @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.cMkpLgadlLCzDOv0]{Blessing of the Five}

Order of the Nail.name: Order of the Nail
Order of the Nail.description:
Favored Weapons @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.dgWxsYm0DWHb27h6]{Halberd}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.OPMzQdM9rZznMGhW]{Lance}

Members of the Order of the Nail see civilized society as an ideal and seek to unite all people within their cultural baseline. They also seek to destroy anyone who does not accept Chelaxian culture along with the wild beasts that threaten the safety of civilization.

Lesser Benefit @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.PpJURSJFEHzhutdp]{Trailblazing Stride}

Greater Benefit @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.PPSH5vdf90KC95jJ]{Reveal Beasts}

Order of the Pyre.name: Order of the Pyre
Order of the Pyre.description:
Favored Weapon @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.vlnzTSsRmWeSkt9O]{Glaive}

The Order of the Pyre is dedicated to eliminating those faiths and beliefs they consider to be a threat to the Inner Sea region. They are particularly keen on stamping out dangerous cults.

Lesser Benefit @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.Kz4E8heU12IGcYoi]{Righteous Resistance}

Greater Benefit @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.FlsAYAGEiZg1gg7D]{Spiritual Disruption}

Order of the Rack.name: Order of the Rack
Order of the Rack.description:
Favored Weapons @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.LJdbVTOZog39EEbi]{Longsword}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.f1gwoTkf3Nn0v3PN]{Whip}

Members of the Order of the Rack seek to eliminate wastefulness throughout the Inner Sea region. They seek to quash pointless dreams, quell rebellions, and destroy dangerous inventions.

Lesser Benefit @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.RkvAuikI0kIZlQTU]{Disillusionment}

Greater Benefit @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.tPhhaCbaQqwenkzx]{Silence Heresy}

Order of the Scourge.name: Order of the Scourge
Order of the Scourge.description:
Favored Weapons @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.9iDqOLNFKxiTcFKE]{Mace}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.I5DJUbAFGMwa6qCz]{Scourge}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.f1gwoTkf3Nn0v3PN]{Whip}

Hellknights of the Order of the Scourge hunt those who pervert the law for their own selfish ends. They seek to destroy corruption and those who hide behind unjust laws and bureaucracy.

Lesser Benefit @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.AxjjAoU1IZaNUGGS]{Fear No Law, Fear No One}

Greater Benefit @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.1xpqOpguTUAeFsdO]{Seek Injustice}

Otherworldly Protection.name: Otherworldly Protection
Otherworldly Protection.description: Just because you use science doesn't mean you can't build your armor with carefully chosen materials and gizmos designed to protect against otherworldly attacks. You gain resistance equal to 3 + half your level to void damage, or to vitality damage if you have void healing (such as if you're a dhampir). You gain the same amount of resistance to any types of alignment damage—good, evil, chaotic, lawful—that can damage you (note that creatures don't take a given type of alignment damage unless they are of the opposing alignment; for instance, you can take spirit damage only if you are good in alignment).

Outwit.name: Outwit
Outwit.description: You are talented at outwitting your prey. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC against your prey's attacks and a +2 circumstance bonus to Deception checks, Intimidation checks, Stealth checks, and any checks to Recall Knowledge about the prey.

Overdrive.name: Overdrive
Overdrive.description: You have a bevy of smaller devices of your own invention, from muscle stimulants to concussive pistons. When it's necessary, you can throw them into @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3D9kGfwg4LUZBR9A]{Overdrive} to assist you in combat.

Pacification Tools.name: Pacification Tools
Pacification Tools.description: Softer materials make your weapon suited to knock out instead of kill, and special protrusions let you catch weapons and disarm your foes. Your innovation gains the disarm and nonlethal traits. You can choose whether to apply the nonlethal trait on each attack with your innovation.

Palatine Detective.name: Palatine Detective
Palatine Detective.description:
Whether at the invitation of a senior member of the Esoteric Order of the Palatine Eye, after going through a rigorous sorting process, or by a twist of fate, you recently underwent a secret ritual involving The Lost Gospels of Tabris that granted you a greater understanding of both the divine and the occult. Not even you are certain of the origin or purpose of the forces that have granted you these abilities, but you know the key to answering that question and expanding your power lies hidden behind the cryptic words of the many ancient texts still waiting to be discovered and examined. If you choose this class archetype, you must select Palatine Detective Dedication as your 2nd-level class feat.

Prerequisites: You must be an investigator. You are affiliated with the Esoteric Order of the Palatine Eye.

Palatine Detective Adjustments: Instead of choosing a methodology from others available to the investigator class, you have the esoterica methodology (see below).

Additional Feats: 6th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.dVzPTpZoGSi5NR6y]{Cast Out}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.yMj9WfPctWQC7be2]{Thaumaturgic Ritualist}.

Esoterica Methodology

You become trained in Occultism or Religion, and you gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.IlOQuCQIhjJpig3S]{Quick Identification} skill feat. In addition, choose one common cantrip from the divine spell list and one common cantrip from the occult spell list. You can cast those spells as innate spells at will. You become trained in the spell attack modifier and spell DCs statistics. Intelligence is your spellcasting attribute.

Panache.name: Panache
Panache.description:
You care as much about the way you accomplish something as whether you actually accomplish it in the first place. When you perform an action with particular style, you can leverage this moment of verve to perform spectacular, deadly maneuvers. This heightened state of flair is called panache.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.uBJsxCzNhje8m8jj]{Effect: Panache}

You gain panache by performing actions that have the bravado trait. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]{Tumble Through} and additional actions determined by your swashbuckler's style gain the bravado trait when you use them. The GM might determine that a check to perform a particularly daring action, such as swinging on a chandelier or sliding down a drapery, can gain the bravado trait. These checks typically involve at least a single action and a non-trivial DC. Normally, you gain and use panache only in combat encounters; when an encounter ends, you lose panache.

Powerful finisher actions, including @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.K878asDgf1EF0B9S]{Confident Finisher}, can be used only while you have panache and cause you to lose your panache.

Paradox of Opposites.name: Paradox of Opposites
Paradox of Opposites.description:
Life and death, good and evil, light and shadow, vitality and void energy—these diametrically opposed concepts exist everywhere, and your patron walks the line between them. You first encountered your patron in a place or situation of such duality, such as witnessing a baby being born in a cemetery or feeling the natural light of a sunbeam in an otherwise dark cavern. There is power to be derived from the interplay between seemingly antithetical ideas and striking a balance between the two. Your patron could be a monitor demigod interested in cultivating a cosmic balance or an entity that plays fast and loose with morality. They are the difference between the two sides of the same coin while also being the entirety of the coin.

Spell List divine

Patron Skill Religion

Lesson of the Twilit Soul For your patron, life and death and sleeping and waking have the same meaning. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4U2ZV1v38D0y2CRl]{Trade Death for Life} hex cantrip and your familiar learns @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o4lRVTwSxnOOn5vl]{Sleep}.

Familiar of Paired Perplexity Your familiar has twice as many of a small feature than a normal creature would have, such a second tail or an extra pair of whiskers. When you Cast or Sustain a hex, your familiar seems to double and be in two places at once. One creature you choose within 20 feet of it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the start of your next turn; this is a visual effect.

Paragon Benefit (Amulet).name: Paragon Benefit (Amulet)
Paragon Benefit (Amulet).description:
Your amulet provides sanctuary even against wide-scale attacks. When you use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Or6RLXeoZkN8CLdi]{Amulet's Abeyance}, you target yourself and all allies within 15 feet. Each target gains both the initial resistance against the triggering damage and the lingering resistance from your amulet's adept benefit; the allies gain the lingering resistance even if they would not have taken any of the initial triggering damage.

If the foe's attack deals multiple damage types, each target can separately choose the damage type to gain lingering resistance against.

Paragon Benefit (Bell).name: Paragon Benefit (Bell)
Paragon Benefit (Bell).description: With your mastery of your bell, you can affect many foes with ease. All the condition values from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ublVm5gmCIm3eRdQ]{Ring Bell} increase to 2 (or 3 on a critical failure). Ring Bell can trigger off the Strike or spell of any enemy, not just the target of your @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.fodJ3zuwQsYnBbtk]{Exploit Vulnerability}; however, in that case, the condition lasts only until the start of your next turn.

Paragon Benefit (Chalice).name: Paragon Benefit (Chalice)
Paragon Benefit (Chalice).description:
When you or an ally drain the chalice, the overwhelming vitality it's collected helps you overcome many ailments. Reduce the drinker's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} values by 1. (This reduces the stunned condition only if it has a condition value, not when it has a duration.) The drinker also reduces its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} value by 1, but it can reduce its drained condition by Drinking from the Chalice only once per day.

In addition, the chalice attempts to counteract all poisons, diseases, and curses afflicting the drinker, using half your level rounded up as the counteract rank and your class DC - 10 as the counteract modifier. If the chalice fails to counteract a given affliction for a drinker, it can't attempt to counteract that affliction again until midnight.

Paragon Benefit (Lantern).name: Paragon Benefit (Lantern)
Paragon Benefit (Lantern).description: In addition to the other benefits, your lantern reveals all things as they truly are. The bright light increases to 40 feet, with dim light out 40 feet further. While you're holding your lantern, the GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation that comes within the lantern's bright light, but only for the purpose of determining whether you and others can see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, you can see the creature's true form, but you don't end the spell). Use half your level rounded up as the counteract rank and your class DC - 10 as the counteract modifier. On a failed counteract check, the lantern can't attempt to counteract that illusion or polymorph effect again until midnight. You can choose to leave any illusion or transmutation you discover intact, instead of counteracting it.

Paragon Benefit (Mirror).name: Paragon Benefit (Mirror)
Paragon Benefit (Mirror).description: You've become so skilled at reflecting yourself that you can combine making a reflection with your other movements to act right away. When you use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Mh4Vdg6gu8g8RAjh]{Mirror's Reflection}, you can have one of your selves immediately @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interact}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strike}.

Paragon Benefit (Regalia).name: Paragon Benefit (Regalia)
Paragon Benefit (Regalia).description:
Your regalia grants you the true gravitas of rulership, tying together the hearts and minds of your allies and making it impossible for you to leave a bad impression. If you roll a critical failure on a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request}, you get a failure instead. When others use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tfa4Sh7wcxCEqL29]{Follow the Expert} to follow you, you grant them a +3 circumstance bonus if you are trained or +4 if you are an expert or above.

Allies in your inspiring aura aren't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} from being flanked unless you too are flanked. If one of your allies in the aura is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied}, the status penalty your ally takes from the condition is 1 lower than the condition's value as long as the ally remains in the aura, unless you too are affected by the same condition.

Paragon Benefit (Tome).name: Paragon Benefit (Tome)
Paragon Benefit (Tome).description:
In addition to the other benefits, your tome's information alerts you to ambushes and attacks from your foes. While holding your tome, you can always roll a skill check for initiative against creatures or haunts using Esoteric Lore. If you do, you gain a +3 circumstance bonus to your initiative roll.

The initiate benefit's circumstance bonus to Recall Knowledge from holding your tome increases from +1 to +2. When you succeed at the Recall Knowledge check granted by the tome's adept benefit, the bonus applies to all attack rolls you make before the start of your next turn, not just your next one. Lastly, when you gain temporary skill proficiencies, both are legendary.

Paragon Benefit (Wand).name: Paragon Benefit (Wand)
Paragon Benefit (Wand).description: Your mastery of your wand grants you increased versatility, range, and area. The range of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.04VQuQih77pxX06q]{Fling Magic} increases to 180 feet. You gain the ability to choose between all three damage types (cold, electricity, and fire) each time you use Fling Magic. When you Fling Magic, you can choose to target a single creature or to affect all creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:20].

Paragon Benefit (Weapon).name: Paragon Benefit (Weapon)
Paragon Benefit (Weapon).description: The way your implement connects to your foe makes its interruptions incredibly disruptive. You now disrupt the triggering action on a hit with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.dnaPJfA0CDLNrWcW]{Implement's Interruption}, rather than needing a critical hit.

Path to Perfection.name: Path to Perfection
Path to Perfection.description: You have progressed along your own path to enlightenment. Choose your Fortitude, Reflex, or Will saving throw. Your proficiency rank for the chosen saving throw increases to master. When you roll a success on the chosen saving throw, you get a critical success instead.

Patron.name: Patron
Patron.description:
You weren't born with the power to cast spells, nor have you spent years dedicated to worship, study, or uncovering mystical secrets. Your magic instead has been gifted to you by a potent being, one who knows that by empowering you so, you'll further the being's agenda in the world, whatever it may be. This entity is typically mysterious and distant, revealing little of their identity and motivations. They make their will known to you in abstract signs such as omens, dreams, or similar subtleties rather than words.

Rather than interacting with you directly, your patron works through a familiar—a mystical creature that teaches you, serves as the conduit for your patron's magic, and maybe even keeps an eye on you to ensure you're furthering your patron's nebulous ends.

At 1st level, choose your patron, which determines your spellcasting tradition and grants you the skill for that tradition of magic, your first witch's lesson and a unique familiar ability.

Patron Theme.name: Patron Theme
Patron Theme.description:
Each patron has a theme, regardless of their nature or identity. This theme describes the forces over which the patron grants a witch influence. Some patrons are multifaceted, granting different themes and teaching different lessons to different witches. Your patron's theme determines the following.

  • Spell List You use this magical tradition and spell list.
  • Patron Skill You become trained in the listed skill.
  • Hex Cantrip You gain this special hex cantrip.
  • Granted Spell Your familiar automatically learns the spell listed here, in addition to those you gain through witch spellcasting.

Patron's Gift.name: Patron's Gift
Patron's Gift.description: Your patron grants you the power to command incredible works of magic. You gain a single 10th-rank spell slot and can prepare a spell in that slot using witch spellcasting. Unlike with other spell slots, you can't use 10th-rank slots with abilities that give you more spell slots or that let you cast spells without expending spell slots. You don't gain more 10th-rank spells as you level up, but you can take the Patron's Truth feat to gain a second slot.

Peerless Inventor.name: Peerless Inventor
Peerless Inventor.description: You are constantly inventing, and your skill at crafting is unimpeachable. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.XR95taODq1sq82Du]{Inventor} skill feat, even if you don't meet its prerequisites.

Peerless under Heaven.name: Peerless under Heaven
Peerless under Heaven.description:
For as long as there have been gods, they have made war, and you aim to stand atop the pile when the fighting's over. When you critically succeed on a Strike, divine skill at arms guides your weapon, granting you the critical specialization effect for the weapon group. If you already had access to the critical specialization effect for this weapon, your weapon gains the additional critical specialization effect of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.qUnDHEXteUQGE8yp]{Grievous} rune.

After you Spark Transcendence, your impeccable battle form strikes fear. An enemy of your choice within 30 feet must succeed at a @Check[will|against:exemplar|traits:emotion,fear,mental,visual] save against your class DC or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. That creature is then temporarily immune to this effect for 10 minutes. This is an emotion, fear, mental, and visual effect.

Pelt of the Beast.name: Pelt of the Beast
Pelt of the Beast.description:
Usage worn cloak or belt

This animal hide, whether worn about the shoulders or waist, is all you need to survive even the harshest elements. When you make your daily preparations, choose cold, electricity, fire, poison, or sonic damage. The pelt attunes to that damage type.

Immanence You gain resistance equal to half your level to the damage type the pelt is attuned to. You also treat environmental cold and heat effects as one step less severe.

Transcendence—@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.NdMSHDtV9G7MbdP2]{Survive the Wilds} 1 (aura, manipulate, transcendence)

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.NdMSHDtV9G7MbdP2 inline]

Perception Expertise.name: Perception Expertise
Perception Expertise.description: You remain alert to threats around you. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to expert.

Perception Legend.name: Perception Legend
Perception Legend.description: You notice the almost imperceptible. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to legendary.

Perception Mastery.name: Perception Mastery
Perception Mastery.description:
Barbarian Your instinct heightens each of your senses further. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master.

Bard, Rogue You've developed keen awareness and attention to detail. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master.

Exemplar Through your adventures, you've developed keen awareness and attention to detail, the better to watch over your wards and keep an eye out for monsters and other threats. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master.

Ranger You have highly developed acuity and attention to detail. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master.

Swashbuckler Through your adventures, you've developed keen awareness and attention to detail. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master.

Perfect Fortification.name: Perfect Fortification
Perfect Fortification.description:
Power Suit only

You've outfitted your armor with such heavy fortifications that deadly attacks often lose their edge. Each time you're critically hit while wearing the armor, attempt a @Check[flat|dc:13]. On a success, it becomes a normal hit. This isn't cumulative with fortification runes or other abilities that reduce critical hits with a flat check. Additionally, you gain resistance 2 + half your level against precision damage.

Perfected Form.name: Perfected Form
Perfected Form.description: You have purged incompetence from your techniques. On your first Strike of your turn, if you roll lower than 10, you can treat the attack roll as a 10. This is a fortune effect.

Performer's Heart.name: Performer's Heart
Performer's Heart.description: The greatest performances require an understanding of your own mind and flawless concentration. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Will save, you get a critical success instead.

Perpetual Infusions.name: Perpetual Infusions
Perpetual Infusions.description:
You have learned how to create perpetual alchemical infusions that can provide a near-infinite supply of certain simple items.

You gain the ability to create two 1st-level alchemical items using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.sPtl05wwTpqFI0lL]{Quick Alchemy} without spending a batch of infused reagents. The items you can select depend on your research field and must be in your formula book.

Each time you gain a level, you can swap any number of your perpetual infusions with other eligible infusions.

Perpetual Infusions (Bomber).name: Perpetual Infusions (Bomber)
Perpetual Infusions (Bomber).description:
You have learned how to create perpetual alchemical infusions that can provide a near-infinite supply of certain simple items.

You gain the ability to create two 1st-level alchemical items using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.sPtl05wwTpqFI0lL]{Quick Alchemy} without spending a batch of infused reagents. The items you can select depend on your research field and must be in your formula book.

Each time you gain a level, you can swap any number of your perpetual infusions with other eligible infusions.

Choose two 1st-level bombs.

Perpetual Infusions (Chirurgeon).name: Perpetual Infusions (Chirurgeon)
Perpetual Infusions (Chirurgeon).description:
You have learned how to create perpetual alchemical infusions that can provide a near-infinite supply of certain simple items.

You gain the ability to create two 1st-level alchemical items using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.sPtl05wwTpqFI0lL]{Quick Alchemy} without spending a batch of infused reagents. The items you can select depend on your research field and must be in your formula book.

Each time you gain a level, you can swap any number of your perpetual infusions with other eligible infusions.

Choose two 1st-level elixirs with the healing trait. If a creature heals Hit Points from a perpetual infusion, that creature is temporarily immune to healing Hit Points from subsequent perpetual infusions for 10 minutes (but not immune to any other effects of those infusions).

Perpetual Infusions (Mutagenist).name: Perpetual Infusions (Mutagenist)
